data.title: Returning guest
data.text: Super clean and Home like great value for the price great breakfast spacious grounds most importantly clean clean clean

data.title: Horrible Stay
data.text: We arrived at about 11:00 PM and had to leave by 1:00 AM. The room smelled liked marijuana when we arrived , the towels were filthy and then to top it off when my husband came to bed after the lights had been off for a while there were bed bugs on the pillows sheet and comforter. I couldn't bring myself to look at the mattress itself.  We left immediately and got a room at another hotel at 1:00 AM.

data.title: A sweet suite!
data.text: We stayed for two nights visiting family in the area. I have stayed in suites in the past that were actually just one big room. The separate bedroom with actual doors was much appreciated and the separation of space made for a more comfortable stay. The king sized bed was sooo comfy we checked out the brand of mattress!! Kitchen facilities were complete and clean. Living room furniture was comfy also.The complimentary breakfast was great with many choices! When we were leaving, my comment was - I wish we had been able to spend more time relaxing in this suite!

data.title: Good location, very clean
data.text:
Stayed for 2 nights. Very clean hotel. Rooms were roomy but living room isn't as large as they show in their advertisement.  Kitchen was very clean (fridge, microwave), which is a plus for me, because I'm picky like that.  Coney Island is within short walking distance and had lots of food choices. Bed was very soft and comfortable. I loved it! Air conditioner worked very well and the room got cold very quickly. 

Drawback:  no air conditioner in bathroom, so bring air freshener for those "longer bathroom stays". There was an unusual amount of cameras in the hallways... Like a LOT...it was kinda creepy, because you don't know if they have any hidden in the actual rooms.  Towels were limited and so were toiletries. parking lot was very small and spots were limited.  There were even more scarce since there is construction going on in an entire half of the hotel.

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Jade!

We are very sorry about the re-roofing that took place during your time here. We hope to see you again during your next visit to the Warren area. For your next visit, please know that you can call the front desk any time for more towels and toiletries. We certainly don't have cameras in our rooms but do have them in our hallways and outside for your safety. Having a good surveillance system is beneficial in many matters of safety. Thank you for staying with us, again we hope to see you back soon!

Sincerely,

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: good stay and great customer service
data.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel. The room had ample space and a huge bathroom. The kitchenette was functional stocked with wolfgang puck coffee. They included a hot daily breakfast.

In addition to all of this I had accidentally forgotten my Jacket in the room after I checked out and had traveled too far to return to retrieve it. I called the hotel and they were able to locate my jacket and mail it back to me!

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Debbie!

Thank you very much for staying at the Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren during your stay in Warren, MI. Thank you for taking the time to leave the feedback on our property on Tripadvisor. We were happy to accommodate you during your time here. We hope to see you back the next time you're in the Detroit area. We will continue to work hard to make your business visit as much like home as possible. Thank you!

Sincerely,

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Value plus Comfort
data.text: This hotel was equipped with all you need while away on business or leisure. Its conveniently located, offers free breakfast...real breakfast and the beds are oh so comfortable. The staff was quite friendly and it made a week away from home more bearable.

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello!

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave this review on Tripadvisor and for choosing the Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren as your lodging destination. It was a pleasure accommodating you during your stay, we hope to see you back the next time you are in the Warren/Detroit area. Have a splendid day, hope to see you soon!

Cheers!

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A nightmare!!!
data.text: We were in town to see a friend for the last time (he was dying) and we wanted a place where we could stay which would give us some time to de-stress. It ended up adding an unbelievable amount of stress to our visit.  We reserved a jacuzzi suite and yet what we got was a moldy and hairy bathtub (no jacuzzi at all).  We wanted a couple extra pillows and were told we couldn't get any because housekeeping wasn't there and there was no way for the front desk to get any- really?  The 'secure' outside doors were not secure at all as the locks were not working. They put a $100 hold on our bank account because they said we booked though someone other than them - even though we did book through them. There were a few other things but the worst was the lack of customer service.  They did nothing to try to fix any of these problems and had excuses for all of them. When I asked to speak to a manager, the front desk employee said he didn't know how to get ahold of a manager.  A manager was finally available (AFTER we checked out) he continued to have excuses (even blaming bad advertising of the corporate office for as an explanation for not getting a jacuzzi).  So, in spite of everything, all management would do was take off 30% of the bill.  Our visit here made a very emotional and heartbreaking weekend so much worse.  I HIGHLY suggest you stay ANYWHERE other than here.

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,

Once again we are very sorry for your loss and understand how hard these times can be. We are also working on any indiscretions on our end, we have contacted corporate to have the picture on the site changed. We take all of our feedback very seriously and will do what we can to make sure these issues do not happen again. Thank you for taking the time to leave this review.

Sincerely,

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not the same as it use to be
data.text: This was my favorite location to reside when visiting in the Detroit area.  However, it is now old and in need of an update.  I was told there was a recent update to some rooms so I asked for a remodeled room.  However, my room showed little sign of updates.  The kitchenette counter was new and maybe the carpet, but that is it.  Everything else was at least 10 years old.  I also had a visitor one evening and he was given a key to my room without my permission being given.  The front desk just ask me if I know he was coming, but did not say they were giving him a key to come up to my room.  Not was not cool at all.

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello!

We are very sorry for any confusion. We did indeed give your visitor a key to get into the building your room was in but not a key to the actual room. We are very sorry that, that had made you feel uncomfortable at the time. Please be assured that the furniture you used is all brand new. All the furniture that was in your room was custom made for our suites. We hope to get another chance to accommodate during your next visit to the area, we would hate to lose such a great guest. Please call in to the property to set up a reservation for your next stay.

Sincerely,

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: My second home away from home
data.text: The staff at the Hawthorne are great. I've stayed there many times on business travel and they always make sure everything is ok. Mary who is the head of housekeeping is one of the best. She has been there several years, which speaks highly of the management

owner_response.author: HawthornWarren, General Manager at Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello!

Thank you very much for choosing Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Detroit Warren as your lodging destination each time you are in the Warren area. Also, thank you for recognizing our hard work and mentioning it on Tripadvisor, we strive to provide the best guest experience we can. Mary read your review and appreciates it very much! She, along with myself, and the rest of the staff hope to see you back soon. Thank you again, have a spectacular day!

Cheers!

Dean Jamoua
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Our one night stay
data.text: our room was very well equipped with a full size fridge,a microwave and a stove so if you were staying any length of time you certainly could save a lot of money by eating in. the     rooms was very spacious and clean we had a a separate bedroom that also had it's own T V they also had a hot breakfast ,we would definately stay there again.

data.title: The staff was helpful, however the room was dated and...
data.text: The staff was helpful, however the room was dated and cleaning for long term residents was not sufficient. Weekly cleaning for long term residents was weekly but not without reminders.

data.title: wyndam Warren
data.text: Good location, very helpful staff.  We needed a change of lightbulb, and a different iron and the batteries in the safe needed to be changed.  Each of these were corrected within 15 to 30 minutes of calling the front desk.  The iron was mentioned to the front desk clerk while passing the desk and the iron was waiting for us when we got to the room.  Rooms are very quite.  Would stay here again.

data.title: Get away for Two
data.text: Our stay was very pleasant and comfortable. The breakfast each morning was very good too. The rooms just been redone at this location, plus a nice outside pool.

data.title: Very nice hotel
data.text: The room was beautiful, very spacious, and clean.  The kitchen area could use some upgrading.  Lighting in bathroom - shower area- could be a bit brighter.  The sofa bed was quite comfortable.  The ice maker did not work in the freezer.  Minor things compared to the layout of the room along with the very friendly workers.

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text:
I stayed at the Hawthorn during the dream cruise.  The hotel was very nice.  It is in a renovated older building so keep that in mind.  But the rooms looked great.  My A/C wasn't as cold as I would have liked it but I slept great.

The only issue is that the parking is a bit limited.  Typically with hotels you have plenty of parking space.  I ended up having to park close to a dumpster and that wasn't what I had in mind.  

Otherwise, everything was great.  I've stayed at other Hawthorns and really like them.

data.title: Had to leave!!!!
data.text:
The loud music and parties
       should have been a red flag,
but we were so tired
        we were starting to drag.
With all of our bags
         we walked up and down,
when we walked in the room
         I made a big frown!
The smoke was embedded
         in everything there,
my chest started hurting
         It even smelled in my hair.
I had to sign a form stating
          If there's any evidence of smoke,
I pay an extra $250 
          which wasn't a joke!
We moved to other rooms
          which would have cost more,
the smoke was much worse
          when we opened the door. 
We had to leave
          and drive a long way.
Needless to say
          it was a bad way to end our day!
         
        

          
         

just to find out

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Was excellent location, wonderful rooms, great service only thing I found was the glass I used wasn't really clean should have checked it before I poured my pop in it. I was very pleased with our stay!!!!!

data.title: Review
data.text: The room was spacious but old, it smelled the first day,nothing outrageous  just not fresh in a sense. It was not an unpleasant stay but I could not say that I will book there again and I am in Warren MI often.

data.title: charged a "safe fee" that I'll be asking about. . . ...
data.text: charged a "safe fee" that I'll be asking about. . . .  Overall very nice place with very nice staff.  Breakfast was not good and wi-fi kept disconnecting. Will visit again.

data.title: Horrible Night
data.text: We stayed there two nights and the first night was fine. The second night was horrible. A small child was wandering the halls at 3:00am screaming his head off. Then someone with the child went door to door waking the hotel residents trying to find the parents. Then the front desk started calling every tenant room by room trying to find the the child's parents. While this is going on, there is a group of adults under our window by the pool talking and laughing loudly making sure that sleep was not going to happen. Finally the police respond and make them leave at 5:00am. The next morning the desk agent did not even bother to ask how the stay was. Sorry, I just cannot give a high rating.
